p: Although the first study included was conducted in 1968, there was a gap of over a decade before the next eligible study was conducted in 1979 ( Fig 3). Since 1979 seroprevalence studies have been carried out in most years ( Fig 3). An increase in studies conducted for all species was evident in the 2000s ( Fig 3). The peak years for studies were 2007 and 2010 during which reported outbreaks occurred [ 37]. Of the 174 studies, 141 (80%) were conducted during IEPs, 32 (18.2%) during outbreaks and one (0.6%) immediately after an outbreak.
